intro: Arethusa villosa, commonly known as the hairy arethusa, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in wet, acidic soils along the edges of ponds and marshes. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Arethusa villosa is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants.
